description: Construction of a pair of semi-detached four bedroom dwelling houses (with habitable space within the roofspace); with associated integral orangery and outbuildings to both properties (following demolition of existing house)
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title number(s) 917-P11, 917-P12, 917-P13, 917-P14, 917-P15, 917-P16, 917-P17, 917-P18, and 917-P19, received 6th June 2012, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local Planning Authority.   Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, in the interest of proper planning. | Samples of the materials to be used for the external surfaces of the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced, and this condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications as to these matters which have been given in this application.  Development shall be carried out in accordance with these approved details.  Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 4.1 and 5.5 of the Adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment'(2004), and London Plan policies 7.4, 7.5, and 7.6. | Notwithstanding the provisions of Classes A, B, C, D, E or F of Part 1 of Schedule 2 to the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 1995 (as amended),  no extensions to the dwelling hereby approved or outbuildings shall be erected without the prior permission of the Local Planning Authority, obtained through the submission of a planning application.  Reason: To prevent the overdevelopment of the site and to safeguard the living conditions of the residents of adjoining properties and the dwelling hereby approved and the visual appearance of the building, in accordance with policies 4.1 and 5.5 of the Adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment'(2004), and London Plan policies 7.4, 7.5, and 7.6. | Notwithstanding the information shown on the submitted plans details of hard and soft landscaping works and details of boundary treatments shall be submitted to and approved in writing to the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of the development. Hard and soft landscaping works shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details prior to the first occupation of the development, and thereafter retained and maintaine din perpetuity. Any trees or other plants, which die or are removed within the first five years following the implementation of the landscaping scheme shall be replaced during the next planting season, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.   Reason: To ensure that the development is landscaped in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area and to ensure suitable a suitable level of amenity space is provided for occupant of the dwelling hereby permitted, in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.5, and 5.5 of the Adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 13, and London Plan (July 2011) policies 7.4, 7.5, and 7.6. | The access shall be constructed fully in accordance with the submitted details and once provided shall thereafter be maintained with no obstructions above 0.5 metre in height within the 1.5 metre by 1.5 metre pedestrian visibility splays to either side of the access, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: In the interests of pedestrian and vehicular safety in accordance with policies 9.1 and 9.9 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan "New Plan for the Environment" (2004), and London Plan (July 2011) policy 6.3. | The outbuildings hereby approved in association within each dwelling shall only be used for domestic purposes incidental to the enjoyment of their respective dwellinghouse and not for any separate residential use or for any industrial, commercial or business use.  Reason: To enable the Local Planning Authority to maintain strict control over the nature of the use, to protect the living conditions of occupiers in the locality. In accordance with policies 4.1, 5.5 and 5.9 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004); and Supplementary Planning Document 4: Residential Extensions, and London Plan (July 2011) policies 7.4, 7.5, 7.6, and 7.8. | All windows on the flank elevations of the dwellings hereby approved shall contain only obscure glass, and should only have an opening toplight, and shall thereafter be retained permanently as such.  Reason: To protect the living conditions of neighbouring properties, in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.5, and 5.5 of the Adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), and London Plan (July 2011) policies 7.4, 7.5, and 7.6.
